content.value_statement: Teams struggle to create consistent, comprehensive sprint reports that capture progress and blockers. This skill invokes a specialized agent to generate well-structured sprint documentation automatically.
actual_capabilities: Invokes sprint-report-generator agent for automated reporting
Creates structured sprint documentation with standard sections
Captures sprint achievements, blockers, and metrics
Generates reports suitable for stakeholders and teams
limitations: Does not connect to external project management tools for live data
Requires existing sprint data as input to generate reports
Cannot access real-time velocity metrics or burndown charts
Output quality depends on the completeness of input information

use_cases.title: Weekly Sprint Summary
use_cases.description: Generate a concise summary of sprint progress for stakeholder communication. Perfect for managers who need to document completed work, current status, and upcoming priorities.

use_cases.title: Retrospective Documentation
use_cases.description: Create structured retrospective reports that capture what went well, challenges faced, and action items for improvement. Useful for continuous team improvement.

use_cases.title: Stakeholder Status Report
use_cases.description: Produce professional status reports for external stakeholders that highlight key deliverables, risks, and timeline adherence without exposing internal team details.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Sprint Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a sprint report for the past two weeks. Include completed items, work in progress, any blockers encountered, and goals for the next sprint.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need a simple summary of recent sprint activity

prompt_templates.title: Detailed Metrics Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a comprehensive sprint report with velocity metrics, burndown status, team capacity utilization, and quality indicators. Format the output for executive review.
prompt_templates.scenario: When stakeholders require data-driven progress documentation

prompt_templates.title: Retrospective Summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a retrospective document covering what went well, what could improve, action items assigned to team members, and process improvement recommendations.
prompt_templates.scenario: After sprint completion for team reflection

prompt_templates.title: Cross-Team Alignment Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a report that summarizes dependencies between teams, blocked items requiring external resolution, and coordination needs for the upcoming sprint.
prompt_templates.scenario: For organizations with multiple interdependent teams

output_examples.input: Generate a sprint report for our two-week sprint. We completed the user authentication module, fixed 12 bugs, and started the dashboard redesign. Two developers were out sick for a week affecting our velocity.
output: - Reduced team capacity due to illness

best_practices: Provide specific details about completed work, blockers, and team capacity to improve report quality
Include metrics like story points completed and bugs fixed for quantitative reporting
Review generated reports for accuracy before sharing with stakeholders
Use consistent sprint naming conventions to maintain organized documentation
anti_patterns: Providing vague or incomplete sprint information results in generic reports
Using the skill without reviewing output may spread inaccurate information
Expecting real-time data integration without providing input context
Skipping stakeholder preferences when generating reports for different audiences

faq.question: Does this skill connect to Jira or other project management tools?
faq.answer: No, this skill does not integrate with external tools. You provide the sprint information as input, and it generates a structured report from that data.

faq.question: Can I customize the report format?
faq.answer: Yes, you can specify your preferred format, sections, and detail level in the prompt. The agent will adapt the output to your requirements.

faq.question: What information should I provide for the best results?
faq.answer: Include completed tasks, work in progress, blockers, team capacity, and specific goals. The more context you provide, the more comprehensive the report.

faq.question: Is this skill suitable for formal project documentation?
faq.answer: Yes, it generates professional reports suitable for stakeholder communication. Always review the output before formal distribution.

faq.question: How is this different from asking Claude directly?
faq.answer: This skill invokes a specialized sprint-report-generator agent with specific training on sprint reporting patterns and structure.

faq.question: Can I generate reports for multiple sprints at once?
faq.answer: You can provide information for multiple sprints in a single request, but focused reports for individual sprints typically produce better results.
